alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Bighorn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:42PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL JOHNSON... SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN AND NORTHEASTERN WASHAKIE COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Ten Sleep, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ten Sleep around 450 PM MDT. Tensleep Canyon around 500 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Meadowlark Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Bighorn Basin
